intro: Icacorea morii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Icacorea morii plays an important ecological role in Hawaii's native ecosystems.
